options.text: A. Java is a high-level programming language
B. Java is a low-level programming language
C. Both A and B

questions.questionText: When an array is passed to a method, what does the method receive?

options.text: A. Copy of first element
B. The reference of the array
C. Length of the array

questions.questionText: By default a bean is lazily loaded?

options.text: A. True
B. False
C. None

questions.questionText: What types of dependency injection does spring support?

options.text: A. Based on setters, getters and properties
B. Based on the constructor, setters and getters
C. Based on the constructor and setters

questions.questionText: Which of the following statements is correct regarding the spring framework?

options.text: A. The Spring framework is a heavy-weight solution
B. The Spring framework is a light-weight solution
C. Both A and B are true

questions.questionText: Automatic type conversion is possible in which of the possible cases?

options.text: A. Byte to int
B. Long to int
C. Short to int

B. Primitive data type
C. Object References

B. This is the actual action to be taken either before or after the method execution

questions.questionText: How to use ref keyword in beans.xml?

options.text: A. Using setter method only
B. Using constructor argument only
C. Using setter method and construtor argument both

questions.questionText: When is the finalize() method called?

options.text: A. Before garbage collection
B. Before a variable goes out of scope
C. Before an object goes out of scope
